what: Easily Access and Maintain Time-Based Versioned Data (Slowly-Changing-Dimension)
title: Easily Access and Maintain Time-Based Versioned Data (Slowly-Changing-Dimension)
text: R package maintaining data bases slowly-changing-dimensions

title: Easily Access and Maintain Time-Based Versioned Data (Slowly-Changing-Dimension)
text: can install development version SCDB GitHub :
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("ssi-dk/SCDB")  # Use "ssi-dk/SCDB@*release" to install the latest release version

title: Logger — Logger
text: Create object logging database operations

title: Logger — Logger
text: log_path (character(1)) directory log file written (NULL). Defaults getOption("SCDB.log_path"). log_filename (character(1)) name (basename) log file. log_tbl DB table used logging. Class connection-specific, inherits tbl_dbi. start_time (POSIXct(1)) time data processing started.

title: Logger — Logger
text: Logger$new() Logger$log_info() Logger$log_warn() Logger$log_error() Logger$log_to_db() Logger$clone()

title: Logger — Logger
text: Create new Logger object

title: Logger — Logger
code: Logger$new(   db_tablestring = NULL,   log_table_id = getOption("SCDB.log_table_id"),   log_conn = NULL,   log_path = getOption("SCDB.log_path"),   warn = TRUE,   ts = NULL,   start_time = Sys.time() )

title: Logger — Logger
text: db_tablestring string specifying table updated log_table_id DBI::Id() object character string readable id, specifying location log table. log_conn database connection inheriting DBIConnection log_path path logs stored. NULL, file logs created. warn Show warning neither log_table_id log_path determined ts timestamp describing data processed (≠ current time) start_time time data processing started (defaults Sys.time())

title: Logger — Logger
text: Write line log file

title: Logger — Logger
code: Logger$log_info(..., tic = Sys.time(), log_type = "INFO")

title: Logger — Logger
text: ... One character strings concatenated tic timestamp used log entry (default Sys.time()) log_type character string describes severity log message

title: Logger — Logger
text: Write warning log file generate warning.

title: Logger — Logger
code: Logger$log_warn(..., log_type = "WARNING")

title: Logger — Logger
text: ... One character strings concatenated log_type character string describes severity log message

title: Logger — Logger
text: Write error log file stop execution

title: Logger — Logger
code: Logger$log_error(..., log_type = "ERROR")

title: Logger — Logger
text: ... One character strings concatenated log_type character string describes severity log message

title: Logger — Logger
text: Write update log table

title: Logger — Logger
code: Logger$log_to_db(...)

title: Logger — Logger
text: ... Name-value pairs update log table

title: Logger — Logger
text: objects class cloneable method.

title: Logger — Logger
code: Logger$clone(deep = FALSE)

title: Logger — Logger
text: deep Whether make deep clone.

text: .data data frame, tibble, data.table tbl. conn object inherits DBIConnection (generated get_connection())' db_table_id DBI::Id() object character string readable id. temporary table created temporary table? ... arguments passed DBI::dbCreateTable()

title: Create a historical table from input data — create_table
text: Invisibly returns table looks destination (locally conn NULL)

title: Create a historical table from input data — create_table
code: conn <- get_connection(drv = RSQLite::SQLite()) #> Warning: No tables found. Check user permissions / database configuration: #>   host: NULL #>   port: NULL #>   dbname:  #>   user: NULL #>   password: NULL  create_table(mtcars, conn = conn, db_table_id = "mtcars_tmp")  close_connection(conn)

what: Filters .data according to all records in the filter — filter_keys
title: Filters .data according to all records in the filter — filter_keys
text: filter = NULL, filtering done filter different NULL, .data filtered inner_join using columns filter: inner_join(.data, filter, = colnames(filter)) na_by can overwrite inner_join columns used filtering

code: filter_keys(.data, filters, by = NULL, na_by = NULL)

title: Filters .data according to all records in the filter — filter_keys
text: .data data frame, tibble, data.table tbl. filters filter subset data .  filters == NULL, filtering occurs. Else, inner_join performed using columns filter passed inner_join different NULL na_by passed inner_join different NULL

title: Filters .data according to all records in the filter — filter_keys
text: object similar .data

title: Filters .data according to all records in the filter — filter_keys

what: Opens connection to the database — get_connection
title: Opens connection to the database — get_connection
text: Connects specified dbname host:port using user password given arguments. Certain drivers may use credentials stored file, ~/.pgpass (PostgreSQL)

title: Opens connection to the database — get_connection
code: get_connection(   drv = RPostgres::Postgres(),   host = NULL,   port = NULL,   dbname = NULL,   user = NULL,   password = NULL,   timezone = NULL,   timezone_out = NULL,   ... )

title: Opens connection to the database — get_connection
text: drv object inherits DBIDriver existing DBIConnection (default: RPostgres::Postgres()) host Character string giving ip host connect port Host port connect (numeric) dbname Name database located host user Username login password Password login timezone Sets timezone DBI::dbConnect() timezone_out Sets timezone_out DBI::dbConnect() ... Additional parameters sent DBI::dbConnect()

title: Opens connection to the database — get_connection
text: object inherits DBIConnection driver specified drv

title: Opens connection to the database — get_connection
code: if (FALSE) { close_connection(conn) }

what: Get the current schema of a DB connection — get_schema
title: Get the current schema of a DB connection — get_schema
text: Get current schema DB connection

title: Get the current schema of a DB connection — get_schema
code: get_schema(.x)

title: Get the current schema of a DB connection — get_schema
text: .x DBIConnection lazy_query object

title: Get the current schema of a DB connection — get_schema
text: current schema name, defaults "prod" instead "public"

title: Get the current schema of a DB connection — get_schema
code: conn <- get_connection(drv = RSQLite::SQLite()) #> Warning: No tables found. Check user permissions / database configuration: #>   host: NULL #>   port: NULL #>   dbname:  #>   user: NULL #>   password: NULL  dplyr::copy_to(conn, mtcars, name = "mtcars")  get_schema(conn) #> NULL get_schema(get_table(conn, "mtcars")) #> NULL  close_connection(conn)

what: Gets a named table from a given schema — get_table
title: Gets a named table from a given schema — get_table
text: Gets named table given schema

title: Gets a named table from a given schema — get_table
code: get_table(conn, db_table_id = NULL, slice_ts = NA, include_slice_info = FALSE)

title: Gets a named table from a given schema — get_table
text: conn object inherits DBIConnection (generated get_connection())' db_table_id DBI::Id() object character string readable id. missing, list available tables printed. slice_ts set different NA (default), returned data looks given date. set NULL, data returned include_slice_info Default FALSE. set TRUE, history columns "checksum", "from_ts", "until_ts" returned also

what:
Combine any number of SQL queries, where each has their own time axis of
validity (valid_from and valid_until) — interlace_sql

Combine any number of SQL queries, where each has their own time axis of
validity (valid_from and valid_until) — interlace_sql

validity (valid_from and valid_until) — interlace_sql

title:
Combine any number of SQL queries, where each has their own time axis of
validity (valid_from and valid_until) — interlace_sql
text: tables list(!) tables want combine supplied lazy_queries. (group) variable merge colnames time axes validity called "valid_to" "valid_until" inside lazy_query, can specify names supplying arguments list (e.g. c(t1.= "\<colname\>", t2.= "\<colname\>"). colnames must named order given tables (.e. t1, t2, t3, ...).

title:
Combine any number of SQL queries, where each has their own time axis of

title: Checks if table contains historical data — is.historical
text: TRUE .data contains columns: "checksum", "from_ts", "until_ts". FALSE otherwise

title: Checks if table contains historical data — is.historical
code: conn <- get_connection(drv = RSQLite::SQLite()) #> Warning: No tables found. Check user permissions / database configuration: #>   host: NULL #>   port: NULL #>   dbname:  #>   user: NULL #>   password: NULL  dplyr::copy_to(conn, mtcars, name = id("mtcars", conn)) create_table(mtcars, conn, db_table_id = id("mtcars_historical", conn))  is.historical(get_table(conn, "mtcars")) # FALSE #> [1] FALSE is.historical(get_table(conn, "mtcars_historical")) # TRUE #> [1] FALSE  close_connection(conn)

title: Generate sql_on statement for na joins — join_na_sql

title: Generate sql_on statement for na joins — join_na_sql
text: join specification created join_by(), character vector variables join . NULL, default, *_join() perform natural join, using variables common across x y. message lists variables can check correct; suppress message supplying explicitly. join different variables x y, use join_by() specification. example, join_by(== b) match x$y$b. join multiple variables, use join_by() specification multiple expressions. example, join_by(== b, c == d) match x$y$b x$c y$d. column names x y, can shorten listing variable names, like join_by(, c). join_by() can also used perform inequality, rolling, overlap joins. See documentation ?join_by details types joins. simple equality joins, can alternatively specify character vector variable names join . example, = c("", "b") joins x$y$x$b y$b. variable names differ x y, use named character vector like = c("x_a" = "y_a", "x_b" = "y_b"). perform cross-join, generating combinations x y, see cross_join(). na_by columns match NA

title: Generate sql_on statement for na joins — join_na_sql
text: function generates much faster SQL statement NA join compared dbplyr's _join na_matches = "na".

title: SQL Joins — joins
text: x, y pair lazy data frames backed database queries. join specification created join_by(), character vector variables join . NULL, default, *_join() perform natural join, using variables common across x y. message lists variables can check correct; suppress message supplying explicitly. join different variables x y, use join_by() specification. example, join_by(== b) match x$y$b. join multiple variables, use join_by() specification multiple expressions. example, join_by(== b, c == d) match x$y$b x$c y$d. column names x y, can shorten listing variable names, like join_by(, c). join_by() can also used perform inequality, rolling, overlap joins. See documentation ?join_by details types joins. simple equality joins, can alternatively specify character vector variable names join . example, = c("", "b") joins x$y$x$b y$b. variable names differ x y, use named character vector like = c("x_a" = "y_a", "x_b" = "y_b"). perform cross-join, generating combinations x y, see cross_join(). na_by columns match NA ... parameters passed onto methods.

title: Slices a data object based on time / date — slice_time
code: slice_time(.data, slice_ts, from_ts = from_ts, until_ts = until_ts)

title: Slices a data object based on time / date — slice_time
text: .data data frame, tibble, data.table tbl. slice_ts time / date slice from_ts name column .data specifying valid time (note: must unquoted) until_ts name column .data specifying valid time (note: must unquoted)

title: Slices a data object based on time / date — slice_time
text: object similar .data

title: Slices a data object based on time / date — slice_time
code: conn <- get_connection(drv = RSQLite::SQLite()) #> Warning: No tables found. Check user permissions / database configuration: #>   host: NULL #>   port: NULL #>   dbname:  #>   user: NULL #>   password: NULL  m <- mtcars |>   dplyr::mutate(from_ts = dplyr::if_else(dplyr::row_number() > 10,                                          as.Date("2020-01-01"),                                          as.Date("2021-01-01")),                 until_ts = as.Date(NA))  dplyr::copy_to(conn, m, name = "mtcars")  q <- tbl(conn, id("mtcars", conn))  nrow(slice_time(q, "2020-01-01")) # 10 #> [1] 32 nrow(slice_time(q, "2021-01-01")) # nrow(mtcars) #> [1] 32  close_connection(conn)

title: tidyr::unite for tbl_dbi — unite.tbl_dbi
text: data data frame. col name new column, string symbol. argument passed expression supports quasiquotation (can unquote strings symbols). name captured expression rlang::ensym() (note kind interface symbols represent actual objects now discouraged tidyverse; support backward compatibility). ... <tidy-select> Columns unite sep Separator use values. remove TRUE, remove input columns output data frame. na.rm TRUE, missing values removed prior uniting value.

title: Update a historical table — update_snapshot
text: Update historical table

title: Update a historical table — update_snapshot
code: update_snapshot(   .data,   conn,   db_table,   timestamp,   filters = NULL,   message = NULL,   tic = Sys.time(),   log_path = getOption("SCDB.log_path"),   log_table_id = getOption("SCDB.log_table_id"),   enforce_chronological_order = TRUE )

title: Update a historical table — update_snapshot
text: .data tbl object. Typically lazy query DB (get_table()) conn object inherits DBIConnection (generated get_connection())' db_table Either dplyr connection target table specification 'schema.table' timestamp timestamp (POSIXct) update from_ts/until_ts columns filters filter subset data .  filters == NULL, filtering occurs. Else, inner_join performed using columns filter message message add log-file (useful supplying metadata log) tic timestamp computation began. supplied, created call-time. (Used accurately convey long runtime update process ) log_path path logs stored. NULL, file logs created. log_table_id DBI::Id() object character string readable id, specifying location log table. enforce_chronological_order logical controls whether check timestamp update prior timestamps DB

title: SCDB 0.1
text: Features: * Functions handle DB connections * get_connection, close_connection, id * Functions interface DB * get_tables, table_exists, get_schema, schema_exists * Functions create “historical” tables logs * create_table, create_logs_if_missing * Function maintain “historical” tables * update_snapshot * Functions interface “historical” tables * get_table, slice_time, .historical * Functions facilitate faster joins NAs SQL backends * full_join, inner_join, left_join, right_join * Functions manipulate tables SQL backends * filter_keys, unite.tbl_dbi, interlace_sql * logging object facilitate logging * Logger * Function generate checksums * digest_to_checksum * Function write timestamps tables SQL backends * db_timestamp * Helper functions * nrow - DB compliant nrow * %notin% - negated %% Testing: * package functions tested Documentation * functions fully documented
